About me

I'm a Junior at Blackstone Valley Regional Vocational Technical High School in the Electronics shop. I can often be found working on the FIRST robot at the school's robotics club, either writing code or printing out some parts. I'm also contributing heavily to the Smart Escape project, which is a smart dynamic fire evacuation system that points people to the safest route of escape from a fire. Other than that, I'm working on personal projects such as the self-improvement app Deep Space, an app that uses implements AI into habit making. I love learning new things and taking on challenging projects.

Documents

Accomplishments

A list of my greatest accomplishments.

Idea Challenge 2020 - Smart Escape

Innovative Technology - $4,000

The Smart Escape team, which I'm head programmer for, pitched our idea for a dynamic fire evacuation system to the judges at the 2020 $50k Idea Challenge Competition. Due to our resources and working prototypes along with an amazing presentation, we scored the Innovative Technology Award, winning $4k as a result.
FIRST: INFINTIE RECHARGE 2020 - Team 61

Engineering of Excellence Award and 2nd place

Through six weeks of building and testing a +120lb robot, the NE District Northern CT event was our chance to shine. We dominated the end game phase with our pneumatic lift design. As programmer and control driver, I was able to make sure that everything was setup and do any fine tuning necessary. Picture of award can be downloaded by clicking on this card.
FIRST: DEEP SPACE 2019 - Team 61

Judges Award

Judges spend countless hours trying to make sure the a competition runs all smoothly which isn't easy work. As a team we decided to go early to help the judges at the RI District Event. We did it as a thank you for all the hard work they put into these events and it was a great honor for us to receive this award. Picture of award can be downloaded by clicking on this card.

Freshman Portfolio

Lab reports on DC theory and the multimeter project

DC Theory

Experiment 9 - Ohm's Law

In this lab we measured dc voltages with an oscilloscope on complex circuits, with a common reference point.
DC Theory

Experiment 29 - Oscilloscope: Single Reference

In this lab we measured and graphed the relationships between resistance, current, and voltage.

DC Project

Multimeter Project

In this lab, we built a fully functioning multimeter with multiple measurements settings controlled by a rotary switch.

Sophomore Portfolio

Lab reports on AC theory and the power supply project

AC Theory

Experiment 35 - DPDT: Relay

In this lab we observed the operation of a relay acting like a SPDT switch and a DPDT switch.
AC Theory

Experiment 44 - Coupling and Bypass Capacitors

In this lab we observed the effects of a coupling and bypass capacitor.
AC Theory

Experiment 51 - Parallel RLC Circuits

In this lab, we observed the characteristics of a parallel RLC circuit, measuring effects of frequency and comparing phase angles.
AC Project

Power Supply Project

In this lab, we built a fully functioning power supply that has a USB port to charge phones with it.
AC Project

Color Organ Project

In this lab, we built a fully functioning color organ that turns on certain LEDs depending on the frequency.

Junior Portfolio

Lab reports on transistors and op-amps

Mentoring

Freshman Exploratory 7

In this activity, we teach freshman exploring the shop soldering and how basic electronic components work. The card has an attachment that's my recommendation letter for the freshman of exploratory 7.
Amplifiers

Experiment 16 - Troubleshooting a CE Amplifier

In this lab we use dc, resistive, and dynamic checks, combined with our knowledge on the operation and functionality of a CE amplifier, to observe the basic behavior defects in a CE amplifier.
Personal Project - Programming

2019 FIRST Robot Revisions

In this project, I wrote a team 61 library to reduce boilerplate code along with a system that allows the robot to know where the arm is located with limit switches, allowing the robot to move in any position with simple controls.
